meanings.definition: Unable to sit still or relax due to nervousness or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The antsy child kept fidgeting in his seat during the movie.
meanings.sent2: She always gets antsy before a big test.
meanings.sent3: The antsy puppy couldn't wait for his owner to come home.
meanings.sent4: The antsy crowd eagerly awaited the start of the concert.
meanings.sent5: The antsy squirrel darted back and forth, unable to stay in one place.

meanings.sent1: He became antsy waiting in line at the grocery store.
meanings.sent2: The antsy students kept checking the clock during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: The antsy cat meowed loudly for dinner, even though it was still an hour away.
meanings.sent4: The antsy driver honked impatiently at the slow-moving traffic.
meanings.sent5: The antsy toddler tugged at her mother's sleeve, eager to go play outside.
